# Leo Raderman — Category Creator

> Serial entrepreneur who has founded five companies that entered their categories before the categories existed. Six-time founder with $100M+ exits and $65M+ in venture capital raised. Strategic advisor to founders via Pretty Well Fit.

## About

Leo Raderman is a serial entrepreneur, category creator, and strategic advisor based in Northern California. Over a 25-year career, he has founded or co-founded six companies across digital media, experiential technology, mobile, toys, and global healthcare — each time entering a market category before it existed.

He holds an M.A. in Systematic Theology from the Graduate Theological Union, Berkeley, and currently advises founders through Pretty Well Fit, his strategic advisory practice.

## Companies Founded

- [IFILM (1998–2005)](https://www.leoraderman.com/#pattern): Founded internet video six years before YouTube. Sold to Viacom for $49M. Total enterprise exceeded $100M. DreamWorks and Imagine Entertainment folded their online video efforts into IFILM.
- [Obscura Digital (2000–2017)](https://www.leoraderman.com/#pattern): Co-founded architectural projection mapping. Sold to Madison Square Garden Company. Technology now powers The Sphere in Las Vegas.
- [Veeker (2006–2008)](https://www.leoraderman.com/#pattern): Co-founded mobile video communication. First to enable user-generated video clips for NBC News. Pre-FaceTime, pre-Instagram.
- [Nukotoys (2008–2013)](https://www.leoraderman.com/#pattern): Co-founded physical-digital play pattern. 5,000+ retail locations including Apple, Walmart, Target, Toys-R-Us, Barnes & Noble. VentureBeat Best Mobile App 2012.
- [MiracleFeet (2010–Present)](https://www.leoraderman.com/#pattern): Co-founded global healthcare non-profit. 100,000+ children treated for clubfoot worldwide.

## Additional Experience

- Saatchi & Saatchi Darwin Digital (1997–1999): Managing Director & Creative Director. Employee #3.
- Pretty Well Fit (2023–Present): Managing Partner. Strategic advisory for founders building what comes next.

## Key Numbers

- 5 companies founded
- $100M+ largest exit (IFILM to Viacom)
- $65M+ capital raised
- 5,000+ retail locations (Nukotoys)
- 100,000+ children treated (MiracleFeet)

## Capital Formation

$65M+ raised across multiple rounds. Investors include Sony Corporation, Yahoo!, Independent Film Channel, Roy Disney's Steamboat Ventures, Eastman Kodak, Rainbow Media (AMC Networks), Liberty Digital, Axiom Venture Partners, Meritage Funds, and OddLot Entertainment. Presented to the full partnership at Kleiner Perkins.

## Areas of Expertise

- Fundraising & Capital Formation
- Product Development & Go-to-Market
- New Category Creation & Market Education
- Marketing, Sales & Strategic Partnerships
- Legal, Operations & Company Building
- Retail Distribution at Scale

## Honors & Recognition

- Hollywood Reporter 35 Under 35
- GQ Man of the Month
- Red Herring / Newton Award
- IFILM Day — City of Los Angeles

## Press Coverage

Featured in New York Times, Variety, Bloomberg, TechCrunch, Wired, CNET, LA Times, Ad Age, GamesBeat, Communication Arts, Wall Street Journal, Hollywood Reporter, PBS, Fox News, GQ.
